{{also|Schreiben}} ==German== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|de|gmh|schrīben}}, from {{inh|de|goh|scrīban}}, from {{inh|de|gem-pro|*skrībaną}}, a late borrowing from {{der|de|la|scrībō||write}}, which comes from a word meaning "to scribe, to scrape". Compare {{cog|nds|schrieven}}, {{cog|nl|schrijven}}, {{cog|en|shrive}} and {{m|en|scribe}}, {{cog|fy|skriuwe}}, {{cog|da|skrive}}, {{cog|sv|skriva}}, {{cog|is|skrifa}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/ˈʃʁaɪ̯bən/|[ˈʃʁaɪ̯bən]|[-ʃʁaɪ̯bm̩]}} * {{hyphenation|de|schrei|ben}} * {{a|Germany}} {{audio|de|De-schreiben.ogg}} * {{a|Austria}} {{audio|de|De-at-schreiben.ogg}} ===Verb=== {{de-verb-strong|class=1|schreibt|schrieb|geschrieben|past subjunctive=schriebe}} # {{lb|de|transitive}} to [[write]], [[write out]] {{gloss|to form the letters, words or symbols of}} # {{lb|de|transitive}} to [[spell]], [[spell out]] {{gloss|to write or say the letters that form a word or part of a word}} # {{lb|de|intransitive}} to [[write]] {{gloss|to form letters, words or symbols on a surface in order to communicate}} # {{lb|de|intransitive|of a book, etc.}} to [[write]], [[work]] (on) {{gloss|to be an author}} # {{lb|de|intransitive}} to [[write]] (to) {{gloss|to send written information, communication}} # {{lb|de|impersonal|reflexive}} to [[write]] {{gloss|to use for writing}} # {{lb|de|reflexive}} to [[write]] {{gloss|to exchange correspondance}} # {{lb|de|reflexive}} to be [[spell]]ed # {{lb|de|reflexive}} to [[spell]] one's [[name]] ====Conjugation==== {{de-conj-strong|schreib|schrieb|geschrieben|h||||a}} ====Derived terms==== {{der3|de |abschreiben |anschreiben |aufschreiben |beschreiben |Schreiben |Schreiber |Schreiberei |überschreiben |umschreiben |unterschreiben |verschreiben |vorausschreiben |vorschreiben |zuschreiben |wir schreiben das Jahr |Schreibmaschine |Schreibfeder |Schreibtisch |Schreibung |Schreibweise |sage und schreibe }} ====Related terms==== * {{l|de|Schrift}} ===See also=== * {{l|de|lesen}} * {{l|de|malen}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}}
